summary: Over 491,000 people and over 87,000 truck, rail, and sea containers entered the U.S. every day in FY 2021 through 328 ports of entry. U.S. Customs and Border Protection uses 2 public-private partnership programs to expand its port services. One allows partners such as port authorities to reimburse CBP for additional work outside regular hours. Another accepts donations for infrastructure improvements, which could speed up...
title: U.S. Ports of Entry: Update on CBP Public-Private Partnership Programs
